name: 4-(4-chlorophenyl)-4-hydroxypiperidine
Reason: 4-(4-chlorophenyl)-4-hydroxypiperidine has a melting point that we will compare to the base of piperidine, which has a melting point of 106°C. The chlorine atom introduces a strong dipole moment, which can increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions. Each chlorine atom can contribute approximately +10°C to the melting point. Additionally, the phenyl group (C2(CCNCC2)O) adds rigidity and molecular weight, which can contribute approximately +20°C.
